org.spongepowered.api

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    The core accessor of the API. The implementation uses this to pass constructed objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void broadcastMessage(Message<?> message)
      Sends the given message to all online players
      java.lang.String getAPIVersion()
      Gets the API version.
      CommandService getCommandDispatcher()
      Get the command dispatcher used for registering and dispatching registered commands.
      EventManager getEventManager()
      Gets the EventManager.
      java.lang.String getImplementationVersion()
      Gets the implementation version.
      int getMaxPlayers()
      Gets the max players allowed on this server
      java.util.Collection<Player> getOnlinePlayers()
      Gets the Players currently online
      Platform getPlatform()
      Returns the Platform the implementation is executing from.
      com.google.common.base.Optional<Player> getPlayer(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a Player by their name This only works for online players.
      com.google.common.base.Optional<Player> getPlayer(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
      Gets a Player by their unique id
      PluginManager getPluginManager()
      Gets the PluginManager.
      GameRegistry getRegistry()
      Gets the GameRegistry.
      Scheduler getScheduler()
      Gets the Scheduler.
      ServiceManager getServiceManager()
      Get the game's instance of the service manager, which is the gateway to various services provided by Sponge (command registration and so on).
      World getWorld(java.lang.String worldName)
      Gets a loaded World by name
      World getWorld(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
      Gets a loaded World by its unique id (UUID).
      java.util.Collection<World> getWorlds()
      Gets all currently loaded Worlds.

        GameRegistry getRegistry()
        Gets the GameRegistry.
        Returns:

      • getServiceManager

        ServiceManager getServiceManager()
        Get the game's instance of the service manager, which is the gateway to various services provided by Sponge (command registration and so on).

        Services registered by other plugins may be available too.

        Returns:
        The service manager

      • getScheduler

        Scheduler getScheduler()
        Gets the Scheduler.
        Returns:
        The scheduler

      • getCommandDispatcher

        CommandService getCommandDispatcher()
        Get the command dispatcher used for registering and dispatching registered commands.
        Returns:
        The command dispatcher

        Returns:

      • getMaxPlayers

        int getMaxPlayers()
        Gets the max players allowed on this server
        Returns:
        Maximum number of connected players

      • getPlayer

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Player> getPlayer(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
        Gets a Player by their unique id
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - The UUID to get the player from
        Returns:
        Player if available

      • getPlayer

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Player> getPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a Player by their name This only works for online players. Note: Do not use names for persistent storage, the Zidane of today may not be the Zidane of yesterday.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to get the player from
        Returns:
        Player if available

      • getWorlds

        java.util.Collection<World> getWorlds()
        Gets all currently loaded Worlds.
        Returns:
        Collection of loaded worlds

      • getWorld

        World getWorld(java.util.UUID uniqueId)
        Gets a loaded World by its unique id (UUID).
        Parameters:
        uniqueId - UUID to lookup
        Returns:
        The world or null if not found

      • getWorld

        World getWorld(java.lang.String worldName)
        Gets a loaded World by name
        Parameters:
        worldName - Name to lookup
        Returns:
        The world or null if not found

      • broadcastMessage

        void broadcastMessage(Message<?> message)
        Sends the given message to all online players
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send
